metro

Class MetroEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • metro.MetroEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MetroAbstractEvent
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MetroMessageEvent, MetroMidiEvent

    public abstract class MetroEvent
extends java.lang.Object
implements MetroAbstractEvent
    This class is the base class to manage all events that are sent/received between Metro framework and its client.
    Author:
    Ats Oka

      • between

        public final boolean between(int from,
                             int to)
        Description copied from interface: MetroAbstractEvent
        Check if the position of this event is inside the duration specified in the parameter. See MetroTrack.progressCursor(int, List) for further information. This methods is called as a callback of JACKAudio processing; this method should return as soon as possible. The heavy processing that blocks for longer time than the current setting of JACK's frame rate causes JACK to XRUN.
        Specified by:
        between in interface MetroAbstractEvent
        Parameters:
        from - Specifies the beginning point of the duration to check. The value is inclusive.
        to - Specifies the end point of the duration to check. The value is exclusive.
        Returns:
        true if this event is inside the duration.

      • getMidiOffset

        public final int getMidiOffset()

      • process

        public abstract void process(Metro metro,
                             int from,
                             int to,
                             int nframes,
                             java.util.List<MetroAbstractMidiEvent> eventList)
        Description copied from interface: MetroAbstractEvent
        Defines the procedure to execute when this event is activated. This method is usually called when MetroAbstractEvent.between(int, int) returned true. See MetroTrack.progressCursor(int, List) for further information. This methods is called as a callback of JACKAudio processing; this method should return as soon as possible. The heavy processing that blocks for longer time than the current setting of JACK's frame rate causes JACK to XRUN.
        Specified by:
        process in interface MetroAbstractEvent
        Parameters:
        metro - The Metro instance which is the owner of this event.
        from - the value of from when MetroAbstractEvent.between(int, int) returns true.
        to - the value of to when MetroAbstractEvent.between(int, int) returns true.
        nframes - the current
